step_1_context.text: Listen: the children are laughing and the teacher is writing on the board right now.

step_2_explanation.simple_rule: Use present continuous for actions happening now or around now.
step_2_explanation.common_mistake: Do not use base verb after am/is/are in this tense.

step_3_interactive_exercises.question: Pick the correct present continuous sentence.
options: They play in the yard now.
They are playing in the yard now.
They is playing in the yard now.
They were playing in the yard now.
step_3_interactive_exercises.correct_answer: They are playing in the yard now.

step_3_interactive_exercises.incorrect_sentence: I am study for my exam now.
step_3_interactive_exercises.corrected_sentence: I am studying for my exam now.
step_3_interactive_exercises.error_analysis: After am/is/are, use the -ing form, not the base verb.
